intro: Cleome kermesina var. kermesina, commonly known as the scarlet cup plant, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It features striking, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from red to orange, typically blooming from late summer to early fall. The plant has palmate leaves with three to five lobes, and its stems are often branched and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is drought-tolerant once established. Cleome kermesina var. kermesina is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
